document_data.name: Shadowdark House
document_data.mainbody: '''Shadowdark House''' was a [[magic]] shop in [[Daerlun]], [[Sembia]], ''circa'' the [[1372 DR|Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR]]. Its proprietress, Lady [[Thelbaerone Shadowdark]], was often consulted on magical matters.{{Cite dragon/287/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: Shadowdark House|70}}
document_data.Location: This establishment was located on the north side of [[Saurovin Street]], three doors down from the [[Westmarket]].
document_data.Structure:
Shadowdark House was a "tallhouse" of three narrow stories that touched its neighbors on either side. The first floor was built of fitted stones and the upper floors were a lattice of wooden beams with the gaps between them paneled over and plastered with white stucco. The arched door was heavy wood with metal fixtures. Unlike most businesses, here was no sign out front or awning over the first-floor front window.{{Cite dragon/287/Elminster's Guide to the Realms: Shadowdark House|72}}

[[File:Shadowdark-first-floor.png|thumb|right|250px|''Thelbaerone Darkmantle with her legless table, darkmantle, and claw-imprinted flagstone.'']]

Interior.Atmosphere: Shadowdark House had the feel of a curio shop with a dash of danger. It was dimly lit by her floating [[candelabra]] (an [[animated object]] that appeared to be constructed from a scaly claw) and many clouds of twinkling stars (a variation of ''[[continual flame]]'' that she called ''everstars'').

document_data.Defenses:
[[File:Shadowdark-items.png|thumb|right|250px|''Detail of candelabra and ''rod of flame extinguishing''.'']]
Shadowdark House was riddled with defensive magic spells cast in "waiting". Window- and door-frames were the most common spots where trigger words were etched, ready to release the spell they held back when spoken aloud. The proprietress also had personal defensive spells in waiting, including ''[[teleport]]s'' to far-away places and spells that would alter some combination of her apparent age, race, or gender. brain juice that it could spray on opponents to paralyze them.
document_data.History: Shadowdark House was Thelbaerone's residence for at least twenty years before she opened it up as a magic shop. By the Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR, Shadowdark House had been her business for over forty years.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: There were reports of customers being haunted for hours or days by voices, either coming out of thin air as if someone were standing next to them, or inside their head where only they could hear it, all because they stood in the wrong spot in Shadowdark House and uttered words written on the building or furnishings. Others reported seeing a ''portal'' to some unknown location open up for the same reason.
